page.title: 16COGGESHALL
page.content: {COGGESHALL}is a friendly place,with lots of old buildings like Coggeshall House,andthe Woolpack an old inn built in the 15th century. Coggeshall House is a mansion near our school. It has huge grounds with Horse Chestnut Trees. The Clock Tower was rebuilt in 1887. Cockerell,s House in Church St.is 15th.Century. Paycocke's House in West Street is owned by the National Trust. It was built by Thomas Paycocke,a wool merchant, who gave money to rebuild the church. Next door is the Fleece Pub . Grange Barn on Grange Hill dates from the 15th century. It is being restored by a Trust from funds paid by the townsfolk. Nearby are the remains of the Abbey founded in 1140. The Abbey Mill on the River Blackwater is still in working order and controls the water level.
